scenarioDescription:
The KMT-2016-BLG-1107L Exoplanetary System


Overview

KMT-2016-BLG-1107L is a star with 0.09 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 21692.64 light years away from the solar system.

KMT-2016-BLG-1107L is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the KMT-2016-BLG-1107L system


KMT-2016-BLG-1107L b

KMT-2016-BLG-1107L b was discovered by the KMTNet observatory, in 2019-01, using the microlensing method. Its semi-major axis is 0.34 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of KMT-2016-BLG-1107L b is 1043.994 times the mass of Earth. The radius of KMT-2016-BLG-1107L b is 13.100 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, KMT-2016-BLG-1107L b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system KMT-2016-BLG-1107L, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the KMTNet.
name: KMT-2016-BLG-1107L - System With 1 Exoplanet
